intro: Oxydectes pycnocephala, commonly known as the thick-headed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its dense, spherical inflorescence composed of numerous small yellow flowers surrounded by white bracts. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Oxydectes pycnocephala is often found in open grasslands and is valued for its ornamental appearance.
